Big institutions are embracing tokenization.

This week brought new regulatory progress and real-world adoption as the world‚Äôs largest companies begin to move onchain.

Here‚Äôs what you need to know üëá

1Ô∏è‚É£ CFTC pilot allows for tokenized assets to be used as collateral in derivatives markets.

The first-of-its-kind U.S. program allows BTC and ETH, along with USDC and other payment stablecoins, to be used as collateral in derivatives markets.

https://t.co/q6iI9RIkD5

2Ô∏è‚É£ Ondo Finance to invest $200M in State Street Investment Management‚Äôs tokenized fund

Ondo Finance joins with State Street Investment Management and Galaxy Asset Management in plans for a new private tokenized liquidity fund bringing traditional cash management onchain.

https://t.co/FsYytdFNJE

3Ô∏è‚É£ BMW uses JPMorgan blockchain system for automated FX transfers

JPMorgan Chase & Co's Kinexys platform automatically transfers euros from BMW's Frankfurt accounts when dollar balances in New York drop below a certain threshold.

https://t.co/Cal5wkoUYF

4Ô∏è‚É£ The SEC formally closed a confidential Biden-era investigation into Ondo

Regulators are shifting from enforcement-first approaches toward frameworks that support modernized market infrastructure. The path is now clearer for tokenized Treasuries and tokenized equities to become core components of U.S. capital markets.

https://t.co/vMzNu5vi19

5Ô∏è‚É£ SEC approves DTCC to support tokenized equities

The SEC granted permission to the DTCC to custody and recognize tokenized equities and other real-world assets onchain. DTCC can now offer tokenization services on pre-approved blockchains for three years.

https://t.co/GvoE32x6CO

There's a fundamental logic to understand about decentralization: when a single company or individual holds too much Bitcoin, it becomes dangerous and goes against the very principle of decentralization. The risk of a crash then increases significantly.


The best form of decentralization occurs when the majority of the world's population adopts Bitcoin. If 50% to 80% of the population holds BTC, it brings more stability to the market and reduces manipulation. Conversely, when a single person or company holds nearly 5% of the total supply, the risk increases considerably.
